original: @286b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @286b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: bha ga ba ti pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a hri da ya aartha pra d'i pa n'a ma t'i k'a /
analyzed: bha ga ba ti pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a hri da ya aartha pra d'i pa n'a ma t'i k'a /
translated: Bhagavatīprajñāpāramitāhṛdayārthapradīpa-nāma-tīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa don gyi sgron ma zhes bya ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa don gyi sgron ma zhes bya ba /
translated: Commentary on the Heart of the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā called Lamp of Meaning

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā.

original: gzhi dran pa med pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / lam skye ba med pa lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid dang / 'bras bu blo las 'das pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gzhi dran pa med pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / lam skye ba med pa lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid dang / 'bras bu blo las 'das pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the wisdom of omniscience, the basis free from all recollection, to the knowledge of the path, the unborn path, and to the omniscience beyond the mind, the result.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni kun mkhyen ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni kun mkhyen ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
translated: One who pays homage to the perfection of wisdom pays homage to the wisdom of omniscience.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /🔽ae bam ma ya /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /🔽ae bam ma ya /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.🔽Evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye.

original: yi ge bzhi po 'di ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi po 'di ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi 'byung gnas /
translated: These four syllables are the source of the eighty-four thousand heaps of doctrine.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa /🔽sems nyid dang chos nyid kyi ngo bo gcig la dran pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / skye ba @287a * //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa / sems nyid dang chos nyid kyi ngo bo gcig la dran pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / skye ba @287a * //
translated: They are the basis of all perfection.🔽The nature of mind and the nature of phenomena are one, and the four dharmas—mindfulness, non-mindfulness, non-arising, and transcendence of the intellect—are simultaneous.

original: med pa dang / blo las 'das pa chos bzhi po dus gcig pa las zab pa dang / snang ba'i tshul rnam pa gnyis kyis thos so //
analyzed: med pa dang / blo las 'das pa chos bzhi po dus gcig pa las zab pa dang / snang ba'i tshul rnam pa gnyis kyis thos so //
translated: I heard the Dharma in two ways: profound and manifest.

original: de yang zab pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zab pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las 'das pa ste /
translated: The profound is beyond hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: dus gsum du rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / khams gsum gyi sems can ma lus pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma gcig la mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
analyzed: dus gsum du rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / khams gsum gyi sems can ma lus pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma gcig la mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
translated: It is the name for the equality that abides in the single moment of the undifferentiated dharmadhatu of all buddhas abiding in the three times and all sentient beings of the three realms.

original: snang ba ni dran pa'i rnam pa sems can rnams kyi las la chags pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni dran pa'i rnam pa sems can rnams kyi las la chags pa'o //
translated: Manifest is the aspect of mindfulness that is attached to the karma of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa bcom nas chos kyi sku la mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa bcom nas chos kyi sku la mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Lord, having destroyed all the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable, has attained nirvana in the Dharma Body.

original: rgyal po'i khab ni kun nas nyon yongs pa'i gnas rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab ni kun nas nyon yongs pa'i gnas rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The royal capital is superior to all the places of affliction.

original: chos ma lus pa sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bus 'jig rten pa'i cho 'phrul sna tshogs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ma lus pa sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bus 'jig rten pa'i cho 'phrul sna tshogs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are like illusions and dreams, he demonstrates various mundane miracles.

original: bya rgod phung po'i ri ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags shing stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i skyes bu'i bya rnams zil gyis gnon pas spungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya rgod phung po'i ri ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags shing stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i skyes bu'i bya rnams zil gyis gnon pas spungs pa yin no //
translated: The Vulture Peak is superior to all the phenomena of purification. It is a heap because the birds of persons who abide in emptiness are overwhelming.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang ni nyon mongs pa las byol nas rang rang gi 'dod pa'i skam sar gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang ni nyon mongs pa las byol nas rang rang gi 'dod pa'i skam sar gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The great saṅgha of monks is those who, having escaped from the afflictions, abide on their own desired dry land.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun chen po ni shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa mnyam pa dang bral nas thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun chen po ni shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa mnyam pa dang bral nas thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa rnams so //
translated: The great assembly of Bodhisattvas is those who, having separated from the sameness of knowledge and the knowable, etc., have all come to know things as they are.

original: thabs cig tu bzhugs te ni dran pa sna tshogs thabs su shes shing dran pas ma gos pa shes rab rnam gsum dang ma bral ba zab mo'i chos nyid kyi snod du gyur pa rnams dang thabs cig go //
analyzed: thabs cig tu bzhugs te ni dran pa sna tshogs thabs su shes shing dran pas ma gos pa shes rab rnam gsum dang ma bral ba zab mo'i chos nyid kyi snod du gyur pa rnams dang thabs cig go //
translated: They dwell together, knowing that the various kinds of mindfulness are skillful means, and knowing that they are not sullied by mindfulness. They are inseparable from the three kinds of wisdom and are vessels for the profound reality.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba ni zab pa ni dran pa dang rig pa dang blo'i rnam pa gang gis kyang ma gos pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba ni zab pa ni dran pa dang rig pa dang blo'i rnam pa gang gis kyang ma gos pa /
translated: At that time, the Bhagavat was dwelling in the profound illumination. The profound is not sullied by any kind of mindfulness, awareness, or understanding.

original: dpe dang brdas mtshon du med pa yin yang nam mkha' ltar mtha' dbus med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: dpe dang brdas mtshon du med pa yin yang nam mkha' ltar mtha' dbus med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: It cannot be illustrated by analogy or symbol, and yet it is the reality that is like space, without center or edge.

original: snang ba ni dran pa glo bur ba nam mkha' la nam gzhug chad ka'i sbrang bu rgyu ba ltar mi rtag pa dang 'gyur ba can yang dag pa ma yin pa thugs la dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba ni dran pa glo bur ba nam mkha' la nam gzhug chad ka'i sbrang bu rgyu ba ltar mi rtag pa dang 'gyur ba can yang dag pa ma yin pa thugs la dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The appearance is the adventitious memory, like a fly moving in the sky at the end of summer. It is impermanent and changeable, and is not real. This is what the Buddha had in mind.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'o //
translated: The categories of phenomena are the profound and the vast.

original: zab pa dang rgya che ba ni gcig la ma 'dres pa dper na mtsho dang ba la nam mkha'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba ni dkon no //
analyzed: zab pa dang rgya che ba ni gcig la ma 'dres pa dper na mtsho dang ba la nam mkha'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba ni dkon no //
translated: The profound and the vast are not mixed together in one. For example, it is rare to see a reflection of the sky in clear water,

original: nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba ni @287b shin tu mang ngo //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba ni @287b shin tu mang ngo //
translated: but it is very common to see reflections of the sun, moon, stars, and so on.

original: de bzhin du zab pa'i chos dran pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa la 'dris shing yid ches pa'i skyes bu ni shin tu dkon no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zab pa'i chos dran pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa la 'dris shing yid ches pa'i skyes bu ni shin tu dkon no //
translated: Similarly, it is very rare for a person to be familiar with and believe in the profound Dharma, which is without memory, without arising, and not the domain of the intellect.

original: rgya che ba'i chos dran pa'i rnam grangs mi 'dra ba la chags shing yid ches pa ni shin tu mang ngo //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i chos dran pa'i rnam grangs mi 'dra ba la chags shing yid ches pa ni shin tu mang ngo //
translated: It is very common for people to be attached to and believe in the vast Dharma, which has different categories of memory.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba chos kyi dbyings su tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba chos kyi dbyings su tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: The one who has entered into meditative concentration is non-different in the basic field of phenomena from the profound and vast.

original: dper na mtsho dang ba la nam mkha'i gzugs brnyan shar ba na nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan shar ba ni chu bo'i ngo bor gcig pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mtsho dang ba la nam mkha'i gzugs brnyan shar ba na nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan shar ba ni chu bo'i ngo bor gcig pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, when the reflection of the form of the sky appears in clear water, the reflection of the forms of the sun, moon, stars, and so on appear, and they are all of one nature with the water.

original: dus gsum du rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs kyi dgongs pa gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum du rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs kyi dgongs pa gcig pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the intention of the minds of the buddhas abiding in the three times is one.

original: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis dgongs pa'i zab mo'i chos nyid la dgongs nas sems can rnams kyi don du thabs kyi snang ba la gnas pas so //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis dgongs pa'i zab mo'i chos nyid la dgongs nas sems can rnams kyi don du thabs kyi snang ba la gnas pas so //
translated: Moreover, at that time, the bodhisattva, having contemplated the profound reality of the intention of the buddhas themselves, abides in the appearance of the method for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa la gnas nas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa'i don mdzad pas so //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa la gnas nas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa'i don mdzad pas so //
translated: The great being, having abided in the intention of the buddhas of the three times, acts for the benefit of the immeasurable realms of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las 'phags nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyan gyis gzigs shing dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje mda' bas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las 'phags nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyan gyis gzigs shing dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje mda' bas so //
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara, having risen above the mundane and supramundane, sees with the eye of nonconceptual intuition, and his nonapprehending compassion is more intense.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nonerroneous knowledge.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni blo'i spyod yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni blo'i spyod yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is a perfection because it transcends the domain of the intellect.

original: zab mo spyod pa nyid la lta zhing ni dran pa'i rnam pas ma gos pa las sna tshogs shar pas spyod pa ma nges pa la ltos pas so //
analyzed: zab mo spyod pa nyid la lta zhing ni dran pa'i rnam pas ma gos pa las sna tshogs shar pas spyod pa ma nges pa la ltos pas so //
translated: Looking at the very profound practice means that, since various things arise from the uncontaminated state of mindfulness, one looks at the indeterminate practice.

original: phung po lnga po de dag la yang ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa de dag dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga po dag la'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag la yang ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa de dag dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga po dag la'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the five aggregates of attachment, such as the form aggregate, and the five uncontaminated aggregates, such as the aggregate of morality.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong par rnam par lta'o ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po rnams 'dor bar 'dod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po rnams blang bar 'dod pa rnams la rang bzhin ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong par rnam par lta'o ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po rnams 'dor bar 'dod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po rnams blang bar 'dod pa rnams la rang bzhin ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one should view them as empty of intrinsic nature is for the sake of those who wish to abandon the contaminated aggregates and take up the uncontaminated aggregates, in order to teach them that intrinsic nature is not established.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa zab mos khams gsum gyi sems can gyi dran pa'i snang ba la byin gyis brlabs pas spobs pa mtha' yas pa skyes so //🔽byang chub @288a * //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa zab mos khams gsum gyi sems can gyi dran pa'i snang ba la byin gyis brlabs pas spobs pa mtha' yas pa skyes so // byang chub @288a * //
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the Venerable Śāriputra, by the blessing of the profound intention of the buddhas of the three times on the appearances of the minds of sentient beings of the three realms, gave rise to infinite eloquence.

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa zab mo 'ba' zhig la mos pa'i gang zag rnams kyi don la dgongs nas dri bar bya'o snyam du bsam pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa zab mo 'ba' zhig la mos pa'i gang zag rnams kyi don la dgongs nas dri bar bya'o snyam du bsam pa skyes pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara, thinking, For the sake of those individuals who aspire only to the profound intention of the buddhas of the three times, I will ask about it, gave rise to the thought.

original: de la dgongs nas 'di skad ces smras so ;
analyzed: de la dgongs nas 'di skad ces smras so ;
translated: With this in mind, he said the following:

original: / rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo ni theg pa chen po pa'i rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: / rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo ni theg pa chen po pa'i rigs can rnams so //
translated: “Son of noble family or daughter of noble family” refers to those who belong to the family of the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i nang nas zab mo'i don shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos shing dan du gnyer ba rnams so //
analyzed: de'i nang nas zab mo'i don shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos shing dan du gnyer ba rnams so //
translated: Among them, those who are interested in and strive for the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom are the ones who are referred to here.

original: de yang sems nyid gcig pa la rmi lam ltar tha dad du snang ba ni skyes pa dang bud med do //
analyzed: de yang sems nyid gcig pa la rmi lam ltar tha dad du snang ba ni skyes pa dang bud med do //
translated: Moreover, within the single mind, which is like a dream, there appear the different forms of men and women.

original: gang la la ni zab mo'i don la ma mos shing 'jigs pa dang sdang ba dang skrag par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: gang la la ni zab mo'i don la ma mos shing 'jigs pa dang sdang ba dang skrag par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: There are some who are not interested in the profound meaning and who are afraid of it, feel aversion for it, and are terrified by it.

original: la las ni zab mo'i chos thos pa tsam gyi dga' zhing mgu la sems bskyed pa tsam gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: la las ni zab mo'i chos thos pa tsam gyi dga' zhing mgu la sems bskyed pa tsam gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa yang yod do //
translated: There are also some who, merely by hearing the profound Dharma, feel joy and delight and arouse the mind of awakening, and by that alone they attain unsurpassed awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des ni bdag dang gzhan mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ji ltar bslab par bya zhes dris so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des ni bdag dang gzhan mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ji ltar bslab par bya zhes dris so //
translated: Those who wish to practice the profound perfection of wisdom should ask, ‘How should I train, without observing either a self or others?’”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang ni dris pa'i lan gdab par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang ni dris pa'i lan gdab par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having said this, he thinks, I will give the answer to the question.

original: gang gis dgongs she na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis zab mo'i chos la ji lta ba bzhin du dgongs na sems can rnams kyi don du tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gang gis dgongs she na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis zab mo'i chos la ji lta ba bzhin du dgongs na sems can rnams kyi don du tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: By whom is it intended?

original: sh'a ri'i bu rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la ni zab mo don du gnyer ba rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa sh'a ri'i bu la dmigs nas mdo gzhan pa rnams ni snying po med pa spun pa'i rnam pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la ni zab mo don du gnyer ba rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa sh'a ri'i bu la dmigs nas mdo gzhan pa rnams ni snying po med pa spun pa'i rnam pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara, thinking of the profound Dharma as it is, said to the Venerable Shariputra for the sake of sentient beings, Shariputra, for those sons or daughters of good family who are seeking the profound, having taken Shariputra as their guide, the other sutras are like chaff, without essence.

original: gang la la ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo la mos pa dang / la la ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo la mos pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang la la ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo la mos pa dang / la la ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo la mos pa rnams so //
translated: Shariputra, for those who aspire to the sutras of provisional meaning, and for those who aspire to the sutras of definitive meaning.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi snying po yin pa dang / de bas kyang zab mo'i don blo'i spyod yul ma yin pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi snying po yin pa dang / de bas kyang zab mo'i don blo'i spyod yul ma yin pas /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the heart of the mind of the Buddhas of the three times, and moreover, because of the profound meaning not being the sphere of activity of the intellect,

original: zab mo spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa des 'di ltar rnam par blta bar bya ste ni don zab mo'i chos nyid la blos spyad par dka' bas so //
analyzed: zab mo spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa des 'di ltar rnam par blta bar bya ste ni don zab mo'i chos nyid la blos spyad par dka' bas so //
translated: one who wishes to practice the profound should view it in this way: because of the difficulty of practicing with the intellect the reality of the profound meaning.

original: snang ba'i chos la spyad pas ni snying po'i chos dang mi phrad do //
analyzed: snang ba'i chos la spyad pas ni snying po'i chos dang mi phrad do //
translated: By practicing with the phenomena of appearances, one does not encounter the reality of the heart.

original: de bas na dran pa'i snang ba 'di rnams rnam par ma byang gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don rtogs @288b par dka' bas phung po lnga po de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong par yang dag par rjes su blta'o //
analyzed: de bas na dran pa'i snang ba 'di rnams rnam par ma byang gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don rtogs @288b par dka' bas phung po lnga po de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong par yang dag par rjes su blta'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as these appearances of memory are not purified, it is difficult to realize the meaning of the heart of the perfection of wisdom. Therefore, one should correctly see that those five aggregates are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: 'o na phyin ci ma log pa'i zab mo'i chos nyid dang ma phrad pa'i phyi rol pa ni bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag med par lta ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'o na phyin ci ma log pa'i zab mo'i chos nyid dang ma phrad pa'i phyi rol pa ni bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag med par lta ba rnams so //
translated: Now, the non-Buddhists who have not encountered the unerring profound reality have the view of self and the view of selflessness.

original: de yang bdag tu lta ba ni rig pa yang dag par yod par khas len pa rnams so //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu lta ba ni rig pa yang dag par yod par khas len pa rnams so //
translated: The view of self is that of those who accept that awareness truly exists.

original: bdag med pa la mos pa ni rig pa stong pa gnyis su med par smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: bdag med pa la mos pa ni rig pa stong pa gnyis su med par smra ba rnams so //
translated: The view of selflessness is that of those who propound the emptiness of awareness as nondual.

original: de yang gang zag dang chos la bdag med par lta ba la blo goms par bya ba'i don du phyi dang nang thams cad la rdul phra rab tu gzhig cing bltas pas bdag ma rnyed pa la blo goms par byas nas mnyam pa nyid la gzhag pa'i dus
analyzed: de yang gang zag dang chos la bdag med par lta ba la blo goms par bya ba'i don du phyi dang nang thams cad la rdul phra rab tu gzhig cing bltas pas bdag ma rnyed pa la blo goms par byas nas mnyam pa nyid la gzhag pa'i dus
translated: For the purpose of cultivating the mind in the view of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, one should analyze everything, both external and internal, into subtle particles and look. By cultivating the mind in the non-discovery of self, one should rest in equanimity.

original: su ci yang mi dmigs ci yang mi rtog pa de la yun ring du sems gnas pa thob par bya ba'i yul du byas pa na sems dangs shing nyams dga' ba la dmigs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: su ci yang mi dmigs ci yang mi rtog pa de la yun ring du sems gnas pa thob par bya ba'i yul du byas pa na sems dangs shing nyams dga' ba la dmigs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: At the time of resting in equanimity, when one has attained stability of mind for a long time in that which does not observe anything and does not think anything, when one takes that as the object of practice, the mind becomes clear and one focuses on the joy. That is meditative equipoise.

original: rjes la thob pa'i dus su chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / 'ja' tshon lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
analyzed: rjes la thob pa'i dus su chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / 'ja' tshon lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
translated: In the post-equipoise period, all phenomena are like illusions, like dreams, like mirages, like echoes, like reflections of the moon in water, like rainbows, like cities of gandharvas,🔽like a fire wheel, like floating hairs, like a net of Indra, and like emanations.

original: mgal me bskor ba lta bu dang / skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu dang / dbang po'i dra ba lta bu dang / sprul pa'i rnam pa la dmigs nas yid byung zhing sna tshogs stong pa nyid dang zung du 'jug pa la mos pa'i gang zag rnams kyi don du gzugs stong pa'o //
analyzed: mgal me bskor ba lta bu dang / skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu dang / dbang po'i dra ba lta bu dang / sprul pa'i rnam pa la dmigs nas yid byung zhing sna tshogs stong pa nyid dang zung du 'jug pa la mos pa'i gang zag rnams kyi don du gzugs stong pa'o //
translated: For the sake of those who are disillusioned by observing these aspects and who aspire to the union of the diversity and emptiness, it is said, “Form is empty.”

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so //🔽gzugs las kyang stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so // gzugs las kyang stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no //
translated: “Emptiness is form.”🔽“Emptiness is not other than form.”

original: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Form is not other than emptiness.”

original: gzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa'o //
translated: Just as the aggregate of form is empty, so are the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: rnams zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnams zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The word “and” indicates that the eight collections of consciousness are also empty.

original: de'i nang nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zab cing phra ba de don du gnyer ba yod de de ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i nang nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zab cing phra ba de don du gnyer ba yod de de ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the alaya consciousness is profound and subtle. It is not right to pursue it.

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What does this teach?

original: snang ba sna tshogs dran pas yul du byas pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dbang po'i mngon sum gyis gtan la phab pa'i chos thams cad zung du 'jug pa'i dran pa la brten pa so so'i skye bo'i chos bstan zin to //
analyzed: snang ba sna tshogs dran pas yul du byas pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dbang po'i mngon sum gyis gtan la phab pa'i chos thams cad zung du 'jug pa'i dran pa la brten pa so so'i skye bo'i chos bstan zin to //
translated: The illusion-like samādhi in which various appearances are made into objects by memory, and all phenomena determined by the direct perception of the sense faculties, are based on the memory of the union. This concludes the teaching on the dharmas of ordinary beings.

original: da ni zab mo'i chos nyid la brten pa so so'i skye bo'i spyod yul ma yin pa dran pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa @289a * //
analyzed: da ni zab mo'i chos nyid la brten pa so so'i skye bo'i spyod yul ma yin pa dran pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa @289a * //
translated: Now, the domain of ordinary beings is not based on the profound reality, which is without memory and without arising.

original: dang ; blo'i spyod yul las 'das pa de ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum po ni yid kyi mngon sum dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum dang / rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis stong pa nyid rab tu mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dang ; blo'i spyod yul las 'das pa de ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum po ni yid kyi mngon sum dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum dang / rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis stong pa nyid rab tu mi gnas pa dang /
translated: Since that which is beyond the domain of the intellect is the three samādhis of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the three samādhis are the direct perception of the mind, the direct perception of one’s vidyā, and the direct perception of yoga.

original: btang snyoms rab tu mi gnas pa dang / rgyun chad rab tu mi gnas pa dang gsum gyis rkyen gsum dang bral ba'i shes rab rnam gsum gyi gdams ngag ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms rab tu mi gnas pa dang / rgyun chad rab tu mi gnas pa dang gsum gyis rkyen gsum dang bral ba'i shes rab rnam gsum gyi gdams ngag ni /
translated: The three kinds of wisdom free from the three conditions are the instruction of the three kinds of nonabiding emptiness, the three kinds of nonabiding equanimity, and the three kinds of nonabiding cessation.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
translated: Śāriputra, therefore, all phenomena are emptiness.

original: de la ni gzugs med /
analyzed: de la ni gzugs med /
translated: In that, there is no form,🔽no feeling, and so on, up to no exhaustion of aging and death.🔽The samādhi of emptiness is explained in the nirmāṇakāya.

original: tshor ba med pa nas rga shi zad pa'i bar du yang med do zhes pa'i bar gyis stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sprul pa'i sku bstan no //
analyzed: tshor ba med pa nas rga shi zad pa'i bar du yang med do zhes pa'i bar gyis stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sprul pa'i sku bstan no //
translated: The samādhi of signlessness is explained in the sambhogakāya.🔽The samādhi of wishlessness is explained in the dharmakāya.🔽The samādhi of emptiness is explained in the nirmāṇakāya.

original: mtshan nyid med pa /🔽ma skyes pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa / ma skyes pa /
translated: The samādhi of signlessness is explained in the sambhogakāya.🔽The samādhi of wishlessness is explained in the dharmakāya.🔽The samādhi of emptiness is explained in the nirmāṇakāya.

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: The samādhi of signlessness is explained in the sambhogakāya.🔽The samādhi of wishlessness is explained in the dharmakāya.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam med /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam med /
translated: There is no suffering, no origin of suffering, no cessation of suffering, and no path.

original: des ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan to //
translated: This explains the enjoyment body of the samādhi of signlessness.

original: dri ma med pa /🔽dri ma dang bral ba med pa /🔽bri ba med pa /
analyzed: dri ma med pa / dri ma dang bral ba med pa / bri ba med pa /
translated: It is stainless.🔽It is free from stains.🔽It is not diminished.

original: gang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not filled.

original: ye shes med /🔽thob pa med /
analyzed: ye shes med / thob pa med /
translated: It is not wisdom.🔽It is not attainment.

original: ma thob pa yang med do //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang med do //
translated: It is not non-attainment.

original: des ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi sku bstan to //
analyzed: des ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi sku bstan to //
translated: This explains the dharma body of the samādhi of wishlessness.

original: de gsal bar byed pa ni dran pas ma gos pa yid la ma byas pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa ni dran pas ma gos pa yid la ma byas pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The explanation of that is: Unstained by mindfulness, it is non-mentation, emptiness.

original: de yang yid lam byas pa'i stong pa nyid la gzugs med /
analyzed: de yang yid lam byas pa'i stong pa nyid la gzugs med /
translated: Moreover, in the emptiness of non-mentation, there is no form.

original: tshor ba med /
analyzed: tshor ba med /
translated: There is no feeling.

original: 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'du shes med /
translated: There is no perception.

original: 'du byed med /
analyzed: 'du byed med /
translated: There are no formations.

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no consciousness.

original: gang la rnam par shes pa med pa de la dran pa med do //
analyzed: gang la rnam par shes pa med pa de la dran pa med do //
translated: Where there is no consciousness, there is no mindfulness.

original: gang yid la ma byas pa'i stong pa nyid la mig med /
analyzed: gang yid la ma byas pa'i stong pa nyid la mig med /
translated: In the emptiness of non-mentation, there is no eye.

original: rna ba med /
analyzed: rna ba med /
translated: There is no ear.

original: sna med / lce med /
analyzed: sna med / lce med /
translated: There is no nose. There is no tongue.

original: lus med / yid med do //
analyzed: lus med / yid med do //
translated: There is no body. There is no mind.

original: gang la yid med pa de la ni yid la byar med de /
analyzed: gang la yid med pa de la ni yid la byar med de /
translated: He who has no mind has no mental activity.

original: gang dran pa med cing yid la byar med pa de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: gang dran pa med cing yid la byar med pa de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: He who has no memory and no mental activity has the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, and the recollection of the Saṅgha.

original: gang dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa de ni rjes su dran pa rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: gang dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa de ni rjes su dran pa rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: He who recollects the Three Jewels has the highest recollection.

original: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa de ni gtong pa rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa de ni gtong pa rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: He who has no memory and no mental activity has the recollection of generosity, the recollection of morality, and the recollection of the deities.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gtong ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gtong ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of generosity is the nonapprehension of the giver, the gift, and the recipient.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of morality is the nonapprehension of morality, immorality, and the observance of morality.

original: sku gsum mi dmigs pa'i @289b tshul gyis lha rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum mi dmigs pa'i @289b tshul gyis lha rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the deities is the nonapprehension of the three bodies.

original: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa'i stong pa nyid de la ni gzugs med /
analyzed: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa'i stong pa nyid de la ni gzugs med /
translated: In that emptiness, which is without thought and without mental activity, there is no form,

original: sgra med / dri med /🔽ro med / reg bya med /
analyzed: sgra med / dri med / ro med / reg bya med /
translated: no sound, no smell,

original: chos med do //
analyzed: chos med do //
translated: no taste, no texture, and no mental object.

original: gang la chos med pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi chos dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos dang / mi dge ba'i chos dang / lung du bstan pa'i chos dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams med do //
analyzed: gang la chos med pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi chos dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos dang / mi dge ba'i chos dang / lung du bstan pa'i chos dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams med do //
translated: In that which is without mental object, there is no conditioned element, no unconditioned element, no virtuous element, no nonvirtuous element, no element that is to be experienced and no element that is not to be experienced.

original: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa'i stong pa nyid de la ni mig gi khams med /
analyzed: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa'i stong pa nyid de la ni mig gi khams med /
translated: In that emptiness, which is without thought and without mental activity, there is no eye element,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa nas /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa nas /
translated: no visual consciousness element,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang med do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang med do //
translated: up to and including no mind element and no mental consciousness element.

original: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa'i stong pa nyid de la ni ma rig pa med /
analyzed: gang dran pa med cing yid la bya ba med pa'i stong pa nyid de la ni ma rig pa med /
translated: In that emptiness, which is without thought and without mental activity, there is no ignorance,

original: ma rig pa zad pa yang med pa nas /🔽rga shi med /
analyzed: ma rig pa zad pa yang med pa nas / rga shi med /
translated: no exhaustion of ignorance,

original: rga shi zad pa'i bar du yang med do //
analyzed: rga shi zad pa'i bar du yang med do //
translated: up to and including no aging and death and no exhaustion of aging and death.

original: gang skye ba med pa de la ni rga shi med do //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa de la ni rga shi med do //
translated: That which is unborn has no aging and death.

original: gang 'du ba med pa de la ni 'bral ba med do //
analyzed: gang 'du ba med pa de la ni 'bral ba med do //
translated: That which is unassociated has no dissociation.

original: gang rnyed pa med pa de la stor ba med do //
analyzed: gang rnyed pa med pa de la stor ba med do //
translated: That which is unobtainable has no loss.

original: gang byas pa med pa de la 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: gang byas pa med pa de la 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is uncreated has no destruction.

original: gang dran pa med pa de la brjod pa med do //
analyzed: gang dran pa med pa de la brjod pa med do //
translated: That which is not recollected is not expressed.

original: gang rtag pa med pa de la chad pa med do //
analyzed: gang rtag pa med pa de la chad pa med do //
translated: That which is not permanent is not annihilated.

original: 'dis ni stong pa nyid rab tu mi gnas pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yid kyi mngon sum gyis gtan la phab pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni stong pa nyid rab tu mi gnas pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yid kyi mngon sum gyis gtan la phab pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the ascertainment by mental perception of the concentration on emptiness as non-abiding emptiness.

original: da ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi bden pa bzhi mi gnas pas na btang snyoms rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis gtan la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi bden pa bzhi mi gnas pas na btang snyoms rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis gtan la dbab par bya'o //
translated: Now, the four truths of afflicted and purified phenomena are ascertained by self-awareness as the signless concentration of equanimity as non-abiding.

original: de la btang snyoms ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la btang snyoms ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Here, equanimity is sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni dus gsum mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni dus gsum mi dmigs pas so //
translated: That which is sameness is not observed in the three times.

original: de yang mnyam pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa gang gis kyang ma gos pas ming tsam mo //
analyzed: de yang mnyam pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa gang gis kyang ma gos pas ming tsam mo //
translated: Moreover, sameness is a mere name, since it is not sullied by any non-observation.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of affliction is this mindfulness.

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa med pa'i dbyings yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa med pa'i dbyings yin no //
translated: The characteristic of purification is the realm of no-mindfulness.

original: de gnyis mi rgyun dran pa rdul tsam yang med na dran pa med par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de gnyis mi rgyun dran pa rdul tsam yang med na dran pa med par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: If those two do not occur, there is not even an atom of mindfulness, so how could there be no-mindfulness?

original: dran pa'i chos rnams kyang mi rgyu la dran pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang mi rgyu bas skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i chos rnams kyang mi rgyu la dran pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang mi rgyu bas skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: Since phenomena that are mindfulness do not occur, and phenomena that are no-mindfulness do not occur, there is no arising and no ceasing.

original: de yang zab mo'i chos nyid ma rig pa las dran pa'i rnam pa ni kun 'byung pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zab mo'i chos nyid ma rig pa las dran pa'i rnam pa ni kun 'byung pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the aspect of mindfulness from ignorance is the origin of the profound reality.

original: de dag med bzhin du yod par mthong bas sdug bsngal ba'o//
analyzed: de dag med bzhin du yod par mthong bas sdug bsngal ba'o//
translated: Since those do not exist, but are seen to exist, there is suffering.

original: @290a * // yod pa dang med pa'i chos gnyis ka med par ma shes pas ni sbyang bya dang spyod byed lam gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: @290a * // yod pa dang med pa'i chos gnyis ka med par ma shes pas ni sbyang bya dang spyod byed lam gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Since neither existent nor nonexistent phenomena are known, the path of what is to be purified and the purifier is a conceptual form.

original: lam gyi rnam pa goms pa las 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon du 'gyur ba'i 'gog pa thob bya thob byed kyi yul las 'das pa yin pas sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam med ces gsungs so //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa goms pa las 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon du 'gyur ba'i 'gog pa thob bya thob byed kyi yul las 'das pa yin pas sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam med ces gsungs so //
translated: Since the result, the dharmakāya, is actualized from being familiar with the aspects of the path, the object of what is to be attained and the means of attainment is beyond cessation. Therefore, it is said that there is no suffering, origin, cessation, or path.

original: de'i phyir sbyang bya dang spyod byed ma grub pas ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bur gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyang bya dang spyod byed ma grub pas ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bur gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, since what is to be purified and the purifier are not established, it is said that all phenomena are like an illusion and like a dream.

original: sbyang bya ni dran pa 'di kho na'o //
analyzed: sbyang bya ni dran pa 'di kho na'o //
translated: What is to be purified is only this memory.

original: de yang btags pas sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra la rang byung rang zhi ba yin yang /
analyzed: de yang btags pas sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra la rang byung rang zhi ba yin yang /
translated: Moreover, since it is imputed, it is like an illusion and a dream. It is self-originated and self-pacified.

original: bde ba dang rig pa dang stong pa nyid snying rje'i sgron ma spar nas sgom pa ni thabs kyi snying po la brda'i mtshan ma tsam du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang rig pa dang stong pa nyid snying rje'i sgron ma spar nas sgom pa ni thabs kyi snying po la brda'i mtshan ma tsam du shes par bya'o //
translated: The meditation that has ignited the lamp of bliss, awareness, emptiness, and compassion should be understood as merely a symbolic sign in the essence of method.

original: des brda byas nas de las gzhan dran pa mi rgyu ba de la ni shes rab kyi rnam pa tsam du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des brda byas nas de las gzhan dran pa mi rgyu ba de la ni shes rab kyi rnam pa tsam du shes par bya'o //
translated: Having symbolized that, the non-movement of memory other than that should be understood as merely the aspect of wisdom.

original: de gnyis las gzhan ma skyes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa tsam du shes par bya'o//
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan ma skyes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa tsam du shes par bya'o//
translated: Other than those two, the non-arisen should be understood as merely the perfection.

original: de dag las gzhan gang gi blo yang ma shar ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan gang gi blo yang ma shar ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: Other than those, if the mind does not arise, that is called the essence of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir snying po'i don gyi gdams ngag ni dran pa ma lus pa sgyu ma lta bu'i don dang / dran pas ma gos pa stong pa nyid kyi don dang / dran pa dang dran pa med pas ma gos pa mtshan ma med pa'i don dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying po'i don gyi gdams ngag ni dran pa ma lus pa sgyu ma lta bu'i don dang / dran pas ma gos pa stong pa nyid kyi don dang / dran pa dang dran pa med pas ma gos pa mtshan ma med pa'i don dang /
translated: Therefore, the instruction on the meaning of the essence is as follows: The meaning of all memories is illusion-like; the meaning of emptiness is unstained by memory; the meaning of signlessness is unstained by memory and nonmemory; the meaning of wishlessness is unstained by memory and nonmemory.

original: skye ba med pas ma gos pa smon pa med pa'i don yin pas so //
analyzed: skye ba med pas ma gos pa smon pa med pa'i don yin pas so //
translated: Since it is unborn, it is unstained. This is the meaning of wishlessness.

original: gdams ngag gi rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bsam gtan bstan pas so //
analyzed: gdams ngag gi rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bsam gtan bstan pas so //
translated: The explanation of the concentration that is the uninterrupted flow of instructions.

original: de ltar gnas pa'i bsam gtan ngo shes pa'i skyes bu rnams dang / de ltar ngo ma shes pa'i skyes bu rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i bsam gtan ngo shes pa'i skyes bu rnams dang / de ltar ngo ma shes pa'i skyes bu rnams so //
translated: There are people who recognize the concentration that abides in this way, and there are people who do not recognize it in this way.

original: dper na chu khams gser dang nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la glo bur gyi dri mas ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: dper na chu khams gser dang nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la glo bur gyi dri mas ma gos pa'o //
translated: For example, just like the water element, gold, and space, it is naturally completely pure and unstained by adventitious stains.

original: de la mtsho shin tu dang ba la zla ba nya ba'i tshe sprin dang khug rnas ma bsgribs pa'i gzugs brnyan shar ba mthong nas kha cig ni dga' zhing mgu nas yid chags pa skyes so //
analyzed: de la mtsho shin tu dang ba la zla ba nya ba'i tshe sprin dang khug rnas ma bsgribs pa'i gzugs brnyan shar ba mthong nas kha cig ni dga' zhing mgu nas yid chags pa skyes so //
translated: In that regard, when the full moon rises in a very clear lake, unobscured by clouds and fog, some people see the reflection and become happy, delighted, and attached.

original: kha cig ni ci yang snyam pa med do //
analyzed: kha cig ni ci yang snyam pa med do //
translated: Some people do not think anything at all.

original: de bzhin du sems dangs ma rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa mi 'dra ba byung ba la sems dga' zhing mgu bas yid chags shing 'dod chags skyes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dangs ma rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa mi 'dra ba byung ba la sems dga' zhing mgu bas yid chags shing 'dod chags skyes so //
translated: In the same way, the pure mind, which is by nature completely pure, has the aspect of the illusion-like meditative stabilization. Since the mind is pleased and delighted by that, the mind is attached and desire arises.

original: sems dangs ma dang phrad pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyams su myong @290b yang ci yang mi sems so //
analyzed: sems dangs ma dang phrad pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyams su myong @290b yang ci yang mi sems so //
translated: The holy beings who have met the pure mind experience the illusion-like meditative stabilization, but they do not think anything at all.

original: de la gser gyi rang bzhin kha dog ser po de la kha cig gis yid du 'ong zhing rgyan dang nor la sogs pa byed de /
analyzed: de la gser gyi rang bzhin kha dog ser po de la kha cig gis yid du 'ong zhing rgyan dang nor la sogs pa byed de /
translated: With regard to that, some people, with regard to the color of the nature of gold, which is yellow, find it attractive and make ornaments and wealth, etc.

original: de yang g-ya' glo bur du chags pa de la mi sdug par lta zhing zhe sdang skyed do //
analyzed: de yang g-ya' glo bur du chags pa de la mi sdug par lta zhing zhe sdang skyed do //
translated: Moreover, some people, with regard to the sudden arising of rust, view it as unattractive and give rise to anger.

original: mkhas pas bltas pas g-ya' de glo bur pa yin pas bsal du btub snyam zhing mi sdug par lta'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas bltas pas g-ya' de glo bur pa yin pas bsal du btub snyam zhing mi sdug par lta'o //
translated: When the wise view it, they think that since that rust is adventitious, it can be removed, and they view it as unattractive.

original: de bzhin du sems dangs ma dang ma phrad pa'i skyes bu rnams ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems la gces par byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dangs ma dang ma phrad pa'i skyes bu rnams ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems la gces par byed cing /
translated: In the same way, people who have not met the pure mind cherish the mind in meditative equipoise,

original: rjes kyi shes pa la mi sdug par lta zhing re ba dang dogs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: rjes kyi shes pa la mi sdug par lta zhing re ba dang dogs pa bskyed do //
translated: but in the subsequent state of mind they look at it as repulsive and give rise to hope and fear.

original: sems dangs ma dang phrad pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang / rjes la thob pa'i sgyu ma lta bu dang rmi lam lta bur shes shing byams pa dang sdang bar mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sems dangs ma dang phrad pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang / rjes la thob pa'i sgyu ma lta bu dang rmi lam lta bur shes shing byams pa dang sdang bar mi mdzad do //
translated: Holy people who have met the pure mind know that both meditative equipoise and the subsequent state are like an illusion and like a dream, and they do not act with love or hatred.

original: de la nam mkha' ni ming tsam yod la dngos por med pa'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ni ming tsam yod la dngos por med pa'o //
translated: In this regard, space is merely a name and does not exist as a thing.

original: de la yang rkyen gyi dbang gis mun pa dkar ba dang gnag pa la sogs pa sna tshogs 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la yang rkyen gyi dbang gis mun pa dkar ba dang gnag pa la sogs pa sna tshogs 'byung ba la /
translated: Moreover, due to the power of conditions, various things such as light and darkness occur in it.

original: nyin dang mtshan dang zla ba dang lo dang bskal pa bgrang zhing sa dang nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan dang zla ba dang lo dang bskal pa bgrang zhing sa dang nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ngo snyam mo //
translated: Counting days and nights, months and years, eons, earth and sky, one thinks they are very far away.

original: mkhas pas bltas pas sa dang nam mkha'i bar na skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i cha shas tsam yang yod par ma gzigs so //
analyzed: mkhas pas bltas pas sa dang nam mkha'i bar na skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i cha shas tsam yang yod par ma gzigs so //
translated: The wise look and do not see even a hundredth part of a hair between earth and sky.

original: de bzhin du sems dangs ma dang ma phrad pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis dka' ba rnam pa du ma bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du skye rga na 'chi'i 'dam las ma thar bar rang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa 'dod de thob par dka'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dangs ma dang ma phrad pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis dka' ba rnam pa du ma bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du skye rga na 'chi'i 'dam las ma thar bar rang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa 'dod de thob par dka'o //
translated: In the same way, people who have not met the pure essence of mind undergo many hardships for countless eons and are not liberated from the swamp of birth, aging, sickness, and death. They want to attain the result they desire, but it is difficult to attain.

original: zab mo'i chos nyid sems dangs ma dang phrad pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis ni rtogs na sems grol bas sems can dang chos kyi sku'i bar na ci yang yod par ma gzigs so ;
analyzed: zab mo'i chos nyid sems dangs ma dang phrad pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis ni rtogs na sems grol bas sems can dang chos kyi sku'i bar na ci yang yod par ma gzigs so ;
translated: Holy people who have met the pure essence of mind, the profound dharmatā, when they realize it, their minds are liberated. They do not see anything between the dharmakāya and sentient beings.

original: / de bas na zab mo'i chos nyid dang ma phrad pa'i khams gsum gyi sems can rnams ni gzhi dran pa med pa dang / lam skye ba med pa dang / 'bras bu blo las 'das pa /
analyzed: / de bas na zab mo'i chos nyid dang ma phrad pa'i khams gsum gyi sems can rnams ni gzhi dran pa med pa dang / lam skye ba med pa dang / 'bras bu blo las 'das pa /
translated: Therefore, sentient beings of the three realms who have not met the profound dharmatā are the basis, nonmindfulness; the path, nonarising; and the result, the transcendence of the intellect.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcu gnyis las gyur pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcu gnyis las gyur pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The aggregates, elements, etc. are produced from the twelve members of dependent origination, beginning with ignorance.

original: / de la bdag dang bdag gir bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: / de la bdag dang bdag gir bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The aggregates that are appropriated are the basis for the notions of “I” and “mine.”

original: ma rig pa las rig pa glo bur du chags pas sdug bsngal kun gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa las rig pa glo bur du chags pas sdug bsngal kun gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Ignorance is the cause of all suffering, because it is the adventitious defilement of the mind.

original: de yang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du 'gyur ro //🔽sdug @291a * //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du 'gyur ro // sdug @291a * //
translated: Moreover, it is the cause of the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: bsngal de dag las grol bar 'dod pa la las ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rnam pa las goms pa las 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i don du 'gog pa mngon du bya ba la don du gnyer ba yod do //
analyzed: bsngal de dag las grol bar 'dod pa la las ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rnam pa las goms pa las 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i don du 'gog pa mngon du bya ba la don du gnyer ba yod do //
translated: One who desires to be liberated from those sufferings should strive to manifest cessation, in order to attain the fruit of nirvana, which is the result of the practice of the aspects of the path of the noble ones.

original: de dag ma lus pa sgyu ma lta bu dang rmi lam lta bur ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas ni gang yang mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul gyis 'khor ba'i mtshan ma ni sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ma lus pa sgyu ma lta bu dang rmi lam lta bur ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas ni gang yang mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul gyis 'khor ba'i mtshan ma ni sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The signs of saṃsāra are suffering and its origin.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan ma ni 'gog pa dang lam mo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan ma ni 'gog pa dang lam mo //
translated: The signs of nirvāṇa are cessation and the path.

original: de dag thams cad yang dag tu mi 'dzin pas btang snyoms mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad yang dag tu mi 'dzin pas btang snyoms mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: Since one does not grasp at any of these as real, one attains the samādhi of equanimity without signs.

original: da ni rgyun chad rab tu mi gnas pa rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rgyun chad rab tu mi gnas pa rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now, the samādhi of wishlessness will be explained, which is the direct perception of the yogin that is not the domain of the intellect, and which is not interrupted and does not abide.

original: de yang shes pa dang shes bya'i dri ma gang yang ma byung bas dri ma med /
analyzed: de yang shes pa dang shes bya'i dri ma gang yang ma byung bas dri ma med /
translated: Since there is no arising of any stain of knower and object of knowledge, it is stainless.

original: dri ma dang bral ba yang med do //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba yang med do //
translated: It is also not free from stains.

original: chos kyi sku ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa las 'das pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rlom sems med pa ni ye shes med do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa las 'das pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rlom sems med pa ni ye shes med do //
translated: The dharmakāya is beyond thought and meditation, so the conceit of the gnosis that knows all aspects does not exist.

original: de yang ye shes med ces bya ba ni yod pa la ltos nas med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ye shes med ces bya ba ni yod pa la ltos nas med pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, what is called “nonexistent gnosis” is not nonexistence in dependence on existence.

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa las grol ba mi 'gyur ba rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ngo bo tha mi dad pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa las grol ba mi 'gyur ba rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ngo bo tha mi dad pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: Liberated from existence, nonexistence, and so on, inseparable from the essence of the vajralike samādhi, is called the svabhāvikakāya.

original: de yang dbye ba ni sku gsum lhun gyis grub pas so //
analyzed: de yang dbye ba ni sku gsum lhun gyis grub pas so //
translated: Moreover, its divisions are the three spontaneously present kāyas.

original: dgos pa ni zab mo'i don rtogs nas sems grol ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni zab mo'i don rtogs nas sems grol ba'o //
translated: Its purpose is that the mind is liberated by realizing the profound meaning.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni 'bad pa med par sems can rnams kyi don 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni 'bad pa med par sems can rnams kyi don 'byung ba'o //
translated: The secondary purpose is that the welfare of sentient beings occurs without effort.

original: nges tshig ni ye shes med pa chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: nges tshig ni ye shes med pa chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The definition is that the dharmakāya is nonexistent gnosis.

original: chos sku de yang rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu yang ma yin la /
analyzed: chos sku de yang rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu yang ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, that dharmakāya is not a result that arises from a cause

original: las las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: las las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it a ripened result that arises from karma.

original: de lta bu thob pa med ces bya ba ni blo dang sems dang ming dang rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de lta bu thob pa med ces bya ba ni blo dang sems dang ming dang rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pas so //
translated: The phrase there is no attainment means that it is not an object of mind, thought, name, or consciousness.

original: ma thob pa yang med ces bya ba ni blo dang sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa las 'das pas ma khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang med ces bya ba ni blo dang sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa las 'das pas ma khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase there is no non-attainment means that it is not a non-pervasion because it transcends mind, thought, cognition, and consciousness.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na ni de tsam zhig brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na ni de tsam zhig brjod par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, Shariputra, one should only say this much:

original: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs las 'das pa'i phyir ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni khams gsum gyi sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang las las gyur pa'i blo dang sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs las 'das pa'i phyir ro // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni khams gsum gyi sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang las las gyur pa'i blo dang sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: because it transcends the collection of names, the collection of words, and the collection of letters.🔽Bodhisattvas are those who realize and understand the adventitious nature of the mind, thought, cognition, and consciousness of the beings of the three realms, which arises from afflictions and karma,

original: shes pa dang shes bya las gyur pa'i ye shes glo bur bar rtogs @291b shing khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya las gyur pa'i ye shes glo bur bar rtogs @291b shing khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: or the wisdom that arises from cognition and the cognized.

original: thob pa med pa'i phyir ni sa dang lam mngon du gyur pa rnams kyis kyang ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa med pa'i phyir ni sa dang lam mngon du gyur pa rnams kyis kyang ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-acquisition, because of the non-acquisition of the stages and paths that have been manifested.

original: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Wisdom is threefold:

original: thos pa'i shes rab ni ming dang tshig dang yig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab ni ming dang tshig dang yig las byung ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of hearing arises from names, phrases, and letters.

original: bsams pa'i shes rab ni de'i don ma nor bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bsams pa'i shes rab ni de'i don ma nor bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of reflection is the unmistaken reflection on their meaning.

original: bsgoms pa'i shes rab ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i shes rab ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of meditation is the one-pointed mind.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni de dag las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni de dag las 'das pa'o //
translated: The perfection is beyond those.

original: zab mo la brten cing gnas te ni thos pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa ni dran pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo la brten cing gnas te ni thos pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa ni dran pa med pa'o //
translated: Relying on and abiding in the profound means that beyond the wisdom of hearing, there is no conceptualization at all, which is non-mindfulness.

original: bsam pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Beyond the wisdom of reflection, there is no conceptualization at all, which is non-arising.

original: bsgom pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa ni blo'i yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa ni blo'i yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: Beyond the wisdom of meditation, there is no conceptualization at all, which is beyond the domain of the intellect.

original: de lta bu la rten med pa'i tshul gyis brten cing gnas pas sems la sgrib pa med pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i dangs ma sems la las dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas ma gos pas so //
analyzed: de lta bu la rten med pa'i tshul gyis brten cing gnas pas sems la sgrib pa med pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i dangs ma sems la las dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas ma gos pas so //
translated: Since it abides in that way without a basis, the mind is unobstructed. The very pure essence of mind is not veiled by the obscurations of karma, afflictions, and objects of knowledge.

original: skrag pa med de ni zab mo'i chos nyid thos nas mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: skrag pa med de ni zab mo'i chos nyid thos nas mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: It is fearless. When hearing the profound nature of phenomena, it is not frightened, does not panic, and is not terrified.

original: phyin ci log ni zab mo'i chos nyid la ma mos shing srid pa gsum gyi sems can don dam par na yod do zhes dran pa'i chos la yang dag tu mthong bas so //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni zab mo'i chos nyid la ma mos shing srid pa gsum gyi sems can don dam par na yod do zhes dran pa'i chos la yang dag tu mthong bas so //
translated: It is mistaken. It is not interested in the profound nature of phenomena and thinks, “Sentient beings of the three existences ultimately exist,” and sees phenomena as real.

original: phyin ci log la 'khrul pa ni srid pa gsum gyi sems can rnams dper na rmi lam gyi dus su sgyu ma mthong ba'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log la 'khrul pa ni srid pa gsum gyi sems can rnams dper na rmi lam gyi dus su sgyu ma mthong ba'am /
translated: It is deluded about what is mistaken. Sentient beings of the three existences are like seeing an illusion during a dream.

original: rmi lam na thag pa la sprul du mthong ba'am /
analyzed: rmi lam na thag pa la sprul du mthong ba'am /
translated: In a dream, a rope is seen as a snake.

original: gzhon nu ma'i rmi lam na bu skyes pa dang shi ba mthong ba de bzhin du khams gsum gyi sems can rnams kyi bde sdug la sogs pa de 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i rmi lam na bu skyes pa dang shi ba mthong ba de bzhin du khams gsum gyi sems can rnams kyi bde sdug la sogs pa de 'dra'o //
translated: Just as a young woman in a dream sees a son born and dies, so it is with the happiness and suffering of the sentient beings of the three realms.

original: de yang phyin ci log ces bya ba ni ma nor pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa la nor bar mthong ba rnams so //
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log ces bya ba ni ma nor pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa la nor bar mthong ba rnams so //
translated: Moreover, “erroneous” means that those who see the ultimate truth, which is not erroneous, as erroneous.

original: dper na gru rgal ba'i skyes bu kha cig gis ri 'am brag g-yo zhing 'gul bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: dper na gru rgal ba'i skyes bu kha cig gis ri 'am brag g-yo zhing 'gul bar mthong ngo //
translated: For example, some people who are crossing a river see a mountain or a rock moving and shaking.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa'i gang zag gis mnor ba'i chos nyid zab mo la nor pa mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa'i gang zag gis mnor ba'i chos nyid zab mo la nor pa mthong ba yod do //
translated: In the same way, there are those who, not being taken care of by a spiritual friend, see the profound reality, which is not erroneous, as erroneous.

original: dper na seng ge'i 'o ma ni seng ge'i phru gus btung bar bya'i /
analyzed: dper na seng ge'i 'o ma ni seng ge'i phru gus btung bar bya'i /
translated: For example, the milk of a lion can only be drunk by a lion cub.

original: gzhan gyis 'thungs na lus po gas shing dug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'thungs na lus po gas shing dug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If others drink it, their bodies will split open and it will become poison.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can sems shin tu rnam par dag pa la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can sems shin tu rnam par dag pa la bstan par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom should be taught to those of the Mahayana lineage whose minds are very pure.

original: theg pa dman pa'i rigs can la bstan na 'jigs shing skrag la dngang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa'i rigs can la bstan na 'jigs shing skrag la dngang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If taught to those of the Hīnayāna lineage, they will be frightened, terrified, and will panic.

original: dper na @292a * //
analyzed: dper na @292a * //
translated: For example,

original: bad kan can la 'o ma 'thung du bcug na nad mi sel bar dug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bad kan can la 'o ma 'thung du bcug na nad mi sel bar dug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: if one makes a person with phlegm drink milk, it will not cure the illness but become poison.

original: dpe de bzhin du snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos nyid bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dpe de bzhin du snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos nyid bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the profound reality should not be taught to those who are not suitable vessels.

original: de yang 'o ma de nyid zho dang dar bar byas nas bad kan can 'thung du bcug na phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'o ma de nyid zho dang dar bar byas nas bad kan can 'thung du bcug na phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if one makes a person with phlegm drink that very milk after it has been made into curd and butter, it will be beneficial.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i chos nyid la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga dang bsres nas theg pa dman pa rnams la bstan na phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i chos nyid la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga dang bsres nas theg pa dman pa rnams la bstan na phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if one teaches the profound reality of the perfection of wisdom mixed with the five perfections such as generosity to those of the Hīnayāna, it will be beneficial.

original: dper na dmus long mang po rang rang gi grong dang rang rang gi ma dang bral nas /
analyzed: dper na dmus long mang po rang rang gi grong dang rang rang gi ma dang bral nas /
translated: For example, many blind people, separated from their own villages and their own mothers,

original: grong khyer ram grong rdal la sogs par 'khyams te slar log nas rang rang gi grong dang rang rang gi ma dang phrad kyang ngo shes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du theg pa dman pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong dang yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma dang bral nas kyang 'khor ba'i grong las 'khyams nas tshur log nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong dang yum shes rab
analyzed: grong khyer ram grong rdal la sogs par 'khyams te slar log nas rang rang gi grong dang rang rang gi ma dang phrad kyang ngo shes par mi 'gyur ro // de bzhin du theg pa dman pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong dang yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma dang bral nas kyang 'khor ba'i grong las 'khyams nas tshur log nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong dang yum shes rab
translated: wander in cities, towns, and so forth, and even if they return and meet their own villages and their own mothers, they do not recognize them.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don dang phrad kyang ngo shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don dang phrad kyang ngo shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, those of the Lesser Vehicle, separated from the city of omniscience and the mother perfection of wisdom, wander in the city of saṃsāra, and even if they return and meet the city of omniscience and the mother perfection of wisdom, they do not recognize them.

original: de yang thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i dpe dang don gyis de dag gi snying po shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i dpe dang don gyis de dag gi snying po shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, through the examples and meanings taught by spiritual friends who possess method and wisdom, they will understand their essence.

original: dper na rin po che'i 'byung gnas nas rin po che blang bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu rnams phyin ci log gi skyes bu zhig gis ba lang gi rkang rjes la rin po che'i 'byung gnas 'di yin no zer zhing nyan na bar du chod pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i rigs can rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don bor nas /
analyzed: dper na rin po che'i 'byung gnas nas rin po che blang bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu rnams phyin ci log gi skyes bu zhig gis ba lang gi rkang rjes la rin po che'i 'byung gnas 'di yin no zer zhing nyan na bar du chod pa yin no // de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i rigs can rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don bor nas /
translated: For example, people who want to take jewels from a source of jewels are obstructed if they listen to a deceptive person who says, “This is a source of jewels,” pointing to the hoofprint of an ox.

original: mdo gzhan dang gzhan la lta zhing yid ches na bar du chod pa yin no//
analyzed: mdo gzhan dang gzhan la lta zhing yid ches na bar du chod pa yin no//
translated: In the same way, those who have the Mahāyāna lineage are obstructed if they listen to and believe in other sūtras and other [teachings], having abandoned the meaning of the heart of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don gyi gdams ngag la brten pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis spyod pa dang bsgom pa dang lta ba dang 'bras bu'i don bzhi la bsdu bar bya'o
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don gyi gdams ngag la brten pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis spyod pa dang bsgom pa dang lta ba dang 'bras bu'i don bzhi la bsdu bar bya'o
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the four topics—conduct, meditation, view, and result—should be included in the instructions on the meaning of the heart of the perfection of wisdom.

original: // de yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma nor ba snying po'i don la yang dang yang du lta zhing de la sems 'dris par byas pas dran pa'i rnam pa stong pa nyid dang dbyer med pa ni spyod pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: // de yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma nor ba snying po'i don la yang dang yang du lta zhing de la sems 'dris par byas pas dran pa'i rnam pa stong pa nyid dang dbyer med pa ni spyod pa'i don yin no //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of practice is that by repeatedly looking at the unmistaken words of the Buddha and the meaning of the essence and by familiarizing the mind with that, the aspect of mindfulness is inseparable from emptiness.

original: de bas kyang khyad par du 'phags shing yid la mi byed pa'i stong pa nyid rgyun du gnas pa dngos bstan pa ni bsgom pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bas kyang khyad par du 'phags shing yid la mi byed pa'i stong pa nyid rgyun du gnas pa dngos bstan pa ni bsgom pa'i don yin no //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of meditation is the actual teaching of the special, continuous abiding in the emptiness of nonattention.

original: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams @292b rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang dag par mi mthong bas rang rgyud las grol nas skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa ni lta ba'i don yin no //
